titles.title: Captain Scott Corwin Armed Forces Protection Act of 2007
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for punishment for killing a member of the Armed Forces of the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

bill.summary: 10/18/2007--Introduced. Captain Scott Corwin Armed Forces Protection Act of 2007 - Amends the federal criminal code to: (1) provide enhanced criminal penalties for killing, or conspiring or attempting to kill, any member of the Armed Forces; and (2) add as an aggravating factor in death penalty deliberations the killing of a member of the Armed Forces.
